Bases: APIClientError

Exception raised for authentication-related errors.

Bases: APIClientError

Exception raised when retrieving devices fails.

Bases: APIClientError

omnivista_py.omnivista module

class omnivista_py.omnivista.OVClient(url, username, password, verify=True, log=False)

Bases: object

class Device(client, ip_address=None, mac_address=None, hostname=None)

Bases: object

get_all_information()

Returns all information from the device as a JSON object.

Returns:

JSON response from the device

Return type:

dict

Raises:

DeviceRetrievalError – If no device is found.

get_description()

Returns with the description of the Device

Returns:

Configured description of the device

Return type:

str

get_hostname()

Returns with the hostname of the device

Returns:

Configured hostname of the device

Return type:

str

get_ip_address()

Returns with the ip-address of the device

Returns:

IP-address of the device

Return type:

str

get_ip_interfaces()

Returns with all created ip interfaces

Returns:

IP Interfaces

Return type:

dict

get_location()

Returns with the location of the Device

Returns:

Configured location of the deivce

Return type:

str

get_mac_address()

Returns with the mac-address of the device

Returns:

Mac-address of the device

Return type:

str

get_model_name()

Returns with the model names of the device or it returns with the model names of every device in a virtual chassis

Returns:

Model name of the device

Return type:

str or dict

get_running_directory()

Returns with current running directory of the device

Returns:

name of the current running directory

Return type:

str

get_software_version()

Returns with the running software version

Returns:

Module Info

Return type:

dict

get_software_version_advanced()

Returns with every software version for every module

Returns:

Softwareversion

Return type:

dict or str

get_all_devices()

login()

Log in to the API and return the response.
